content: Only two kinds of people can attain self-knowledge: those who are not encumbered at all with learning, that is to say, whose minds are not over-crowded with thoughts borrowed from others; and those who, after studying all the scriptures and sciences, have come to realise that they know nothing.
God is in all men, but all men are not in God; that is why we suffer.
The Man who works for others, without any selfish motive, really does good to himself.
Finish the few duties you have at hand, and then you will have peace.
The winds of God's grace are always blowing, it is for us to raise our sails.
The goal of life is not the earning of money, but the service of God.
If you must be mad, be it not for the things of the world. Be mad with the love of God.
